channel.title: Moparscape is dieing
channel.description:
Is it just me? or is it that moparscape is dieing? I been on forums all day and dont see an single new thread...
post below about your opinion.

item.title: Moparscape is dieing
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

imsuperman05:

Everybody is a hypocrite, dumbass. Predicting weather? Really? 99% of the predicted weather are always wrong. Predicting something will happen doesn’t mean that it will happen.

True

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape is dieing
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:17, topic:438488"][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=541122.msg3967809#msg3967809 date=1333895164]
You can’t assume what’s going to be in the future, or think about it. Just wait for it to come.
[/quote]

Are you retarded? When you plan for something, using the predicted weather, you’re assuming what’s going to happen. You don’t just wait until it’s a good day for whatever you’re planning. You don’t just fap and hope nobody is going to come home.

If you truly don’t assume or even think about what’s going to happen in the future, you’re 9342 steps behind everyone else due to your complete lack of foresight. If you do have foresight, you’re a hypocrite. Either way, you just spewed premature bullshit that you will probably contradict in the next 10 minutes. I wouldn’t get so offended if you had actually developed whatever you’re passing off as information.[/quote]
Everybody is a hypocrite, dumbass. Predicting weather? Really? 99% of the predicted weather are always wrong. Predicting something will happen doesn’t mean that it will happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape is dieing
item.dc:creator: @johnl17 johnl17
item.description:
@johnl17 wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:16, topic:438488"][quote author=johnl17 link=topic=541122.msg3967564#msg3967564 date=1333857058]
I said that, and its just hypothetical, becuase if you think about it. Look at the amount of idiots we have now causing trouble. including me at times And the amount we will have then. Which will theoretically end moparscape.
[/quote]

I don’t even know who you are but you seem like a cancer.

cancer in moparscape
implies all of moparscape isn’t cancer

[hr]

The fact is actually that we all joined here in RS’s peak times at young ages. RS popularity has declined for kids aged 9-12 because they can just hop on minecraft or something and not pay $6 a month. I’d say 3/4 of the RS userbase that is currently active are people that are experiencing nostalgia and decided to come back on RS (even though they’ll leave again eventually). It’s a vicious cycle, and I’ve seen tons of intelligent people fall for it. Anyway, less RS userbase = less mscp userbase = less activity. That’s all you’re experiencing.[/quote]
The idiots i was telling you about.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape is dieing
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“johnl17, post:148, topic:438402”][quote author=heatrn11 link=topic=541122.msg3966898#msg3966898 date=1333808125]
Like someone said, “Morparscape will die 15 years after Runescape does”, And yes I believe this.
[/quote]
I said that, and its just hypothetical, becuase if you think about it. Look at the amount of idiots we have now causing trouble. including me at times And the amount we will have then. Which will theoretically end moparscape.[/quote]
what are you talking about lol?

Interest will die down, that will kill Moparscape most likely, this a semi-symbiotic relationship. This is based on private server programming for runescape but its branched of in a sense so private servers wont die till a few years after if not a while after… Also, mopar isn’t all about rsps:D.

Read full topic

item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I personally just think people’s networks are crappy. I have NEVER lagged on a PI no matter the amount of players. Only time I lag is when I have like five videos going at once.

item.title: Moparscape is dieing
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:135, topic:438402”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=541122.msg3965963#msg3965963 date=1333722659]
Never played a PI that lagged out at 10 players. A shitty PI can hold 50 players. Private servers don’t need to be able to hold 2000 players because not every server has 2000 players. It’s a little depressing when you realize there is no need to have a stable source. The only benefit that can come out of Hyperion and Runesource is it teaches people to learn Java. Even then, there are much better ways to learn.
[/quote]
I’ve played several that did lagg at 20 players but it was because of the host. I was just using it as an example. The main reason to have a stable source would be if you ever get flooded with players from a shoutout or something. The 2nd day DT’s Evolution was online, it got a shoutout and the source couldn’t handle 75 players on a 4gb VPS.[/quote]I personally just think people’s networks are crappy. I have NEVER lagged on a PI no matter the amount of players. Only time I lag is when I have like five videos going at once.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape is dieing
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

as you might know, most of us came here when we were 4-16 years old, that was in what 06, most were very active and wanted to join in the so called RS craze. Now days when you grow up, RS is no longer fun stuff to do. Also there are there are other forums that most us are part of, where you do real programming and work on open source projects, not RSPS stuff

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape is dieing
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

m1lkman:

Never played a PI that lagged out at 10 players. A shitty PI can hold 50 players. Private servers don’t need to be able to hold 2000 players because not every server has 2000 players. It’s a little depressing when you realize there is no need to have a stable source. The only benefit that can come out of Hyperion and Runesource is it teaches people to learn Java. Even then, there are much better ways to learn.

I’ve played several that did lagg at 20 players but it was because of the host. I was just using it as an example. The main reason to have a stable source would be if you ever get flooded with players from a shoutout or something. The 2nd day DT’s Evolution was online, it got a shoutout and the source couldn’t handle 75 players on a 4gb VPS.

Read full topic
